intro: Brachystegia glaberrima, commonly known as the African brachystegia, is a deciduous tree native to central and eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its thick, fissured bark and dense canopy. The tree typically grows in miombo woodlands and has a lifespan that can exceed 100 years. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a waxy coating, while its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences. The plant plays an important ecological role in its habitat, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
